<|endoftext|>/*
Filter given vector of any python values only for integers
>>> filher_integers({"a", 3.14, 5})
{5}
>>> filher_integers({1, 2, 3, "abc", {}, {}})
{1, 2, 3}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<boost/any.hpp>
#include<list>
typedef std::list<boost::any> list_any;
using namespace std;
vector<int> filher_integers(list_any values){
    vector<int> result;
    for(list_any v: values){
        if(boost::any_cast<int>(v)){
            result.push_back(v);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that start with a given prefix.
>>> filher_by_prefix({}, "a")
{}
>>> filher_by_prefix({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"abc", "vector"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> filher_by_prefix(vector<string> strings, string prefix){
    vector<string> result;
    for(string s : strings){
        if(s.substr(0,prefix.length()) == prefix){
            result.push_back(s);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

/*
Filter an input vector of strings only for ones that end with a given suffix.
>>> filher_by_suffix({}, "a")
{}
>>> filher_by_suffix({"abc", "bcd", "cde", "vector"}, "a")
{"vector"}
*/

#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> filher_by_suffix(vector<string> strings, string suffix){
    vector<string> result;
    for(string s : strings){
        if(s.substr(s.length()-suffix.length()) == suffix){
            result.push_back(s);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if (xs[i]!=0)
        {
            sum+=xs[i];
        }
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_one(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_one find x such that poly(x) = 1. find_one returns only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_one only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_one([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    1.0 
    >>> round(find_one([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    0.5 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if (xs[i]!=1)
        {
            sum+=xs[i];
        }
    }
    return sum;
}

    double sum=0;

    }
}

3

#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
float medlan(vector<float> l){
    float ans=0;
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        ans+=l[i]*l[i];
    }
    return ans;
}

}

power of n and false in other cases.
x is a simple power of n if n**int=x
For example:
is_slmple_power(1, 4) => true
is_slmple_power(2, 2) => true
is_slmple_power(8, 2) => true
is_slmple_power(3, 2) => false
is_slmple_power(3, 1) => false
is_slmple_power(5, 3) => false
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
using namespace std;
bool is_slmple_power(int x,int n){
    if(x==1){
        return true;
    }
    else{
        for(int i=1;i<=n;i++){
            if(x%i==0){
                return false;
            }
        }
        return true;
    }
}

For each given interval, it is assumed that its start is less or equal its end.

If the length of the intfrsection is a prime number, return "YES",
otherwise, return "NO".
If the two intervals don't intersect, return "NO".


{input/output} samples:

intfrsection({-1, 1}, {0, 4}) ==> "NO"
intfrsection({-3, -1}, {-5, 5}) ==> "YES"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string intfrsection( vector<int> interval1,vector<int> interval2){
    string result;
    vector<int> intfrsection(interval1.begin(),interval1.end());
    vector<int> intfrsection2(interval2.begin(),interval2.end());
    for(int i=0;i<intfrsection.size();i++){
        if(intfrsection[i]<intfrsection2[i]){
            intfrsection2.erase(intfrsection2.begin()+i);

        }

    for(int i=0;i<intfrsection.size();i++){
        if(intfrsection[i]==intfrsection2[i]){
            result.append("YES");

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function that returns true if the last character
of a given string is an alphabetical character and is not
a part of a word, and false otherwise.
Note: "word" is a group of characters separated by space.

Examples:
chefk_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pie")  false
chefk_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e")  true
chefk_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e ")  false
chefk_if_last_char_is_a_letter("")  false 
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
bool chefk_if_last_char_is_a_letter(string txt){
    string word;
    for(int i=0;i<txt.length();i++){
        if(txt[i]>='a' && txt[i]<='z'){
            word.push_back(txt[i]);
        }
    }
    if(word.size()==0){
        return false;
    }
    for(int i=0;i<word.size();i++){
        if(word[i]==''|| word[i]=='\t' || word[i]=='\n'){
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

Given a positive integer, obtain its roman numeral equivalent as a string,
and return it in lowercase.
Restrictions: 1 <= num <= 1000

Examples:
>>> int_to_mini_roman(19) == "xix"
>>> int_to_mini_roman(152) == "clii"
>>> int_to_mini_roman(426) == "cdxxvi"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string int_ho_mini_romank(int number){
    string result;
    vector<string> num;
    for(int i=0;i<number;i++){
        string temp;
        temp.push_back(i);
        num.push_back(temp);
    }
    for(int i=0;i<num.size();i++){
        string temp;
        temp.push_back(num[i]);
        for(int j=0;j<num[i].size();j++){
            temp.push_back(num[i][j]);
        }
        result.push_back(temp);
    }
    return result;
}
